situation.title: Membership meetings
situation.meta_description: Temporary rules for holding membership meetings.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Currently, it is complained to hold the meeting of members of an association, possible other bodies of associations and other legal entities. Law has always been passed that affects the impact of the epidemic on legal entities.

In practice, there may be situations where a member meeting of the association needs to decide on a certain issue, but it is not possible to meet. For these cases, the law defines the rules for how to make a decision for the duration of the extraordinary measures, even if this is not enshrined in the statutes. Specifically, it is the possibility of using technical devices (eg teleconferencing) or decision-making per rollam (ie by mail or email).

The option does not only apply to associations, but to all legal entities (for example, the meetings of the SVJ).

The validity of the above-mentioned rules was extended by Act No. 460/2020 Coll. until June 30, 2021.

In the case of a membership meeting or election of a body of a legal entity, special regime measures have been taken in the event that more than 10 persons meet in one place, they are:

  • each person must wear a surgical drape or respirator of class FFP2, KN95 or N 95.
  • persons are seated so as to maintain a distance of at least 2 meters from each other.
  • each person must prove a with a negative antigen or PCR test on arrival.
  • a meeting may be attended by a maximum of 50 persons, unless it is a meeting necessary to fulfill the obligations imposed by law, including the choice of body.
